text.0: with words sent forth in holy hymns agni we supplicate the lord.
text.1: of many families who duly serve the gods yea him whom others also praise.
text.2: men have won agni him who makes their strength abound we with oblations worship thee.
text.3: our graciousminded helper in our deeds of might be thou o excellent this day.
text.4: thee for our messenger we choose thee the omniscient for our priest.
text.5: the flames of thee the mighty are spread wide around thy splendour reaches to the sky.
text.6: the gods enkindle thee their ancient messengervaruṇa mitra aryaman.
text.7: that mortal man o agni gains through thee all wealth who hath poured offerings unto thee.
text.8: thou agni art a cheering priest lord of the house mens messenger.
text.9: all constant high decrees established by the gods gathered together meet in thee.
text.10: in thee the auspicious one o agni youthfullest each sacred gift is offered up.
text.11: this day and after gracious worship thou our gods that we may have heroic sons.
text.12: to him in his own splendour bright draw near in worship the devout.
text.13: men kindle agni with their sacrificial gifts victorious oer the enemies.
text.14: vṛtra they smote and slew and made the earth and heaven and firmament a wide abode.
text.15: the glorious bull invoked hath stood at kaṇvas side loud neighed the steed in frays for kine.
text.16: seat thee for thou art mighty shine best entertainer of the gods.
text.17: worthy of sacred food praised agni loose the smoke ruddy and beautiful to see.
text.18: bearer of offerings whom best sacrificing priest the gods for manus sake ordained.
text.19: whom kaṇva whom medhyātithi made the source of wealth and vṛṣan and upastuta.
text.20: him agni whom medhyātithi whom kaṇva kindled for his rite.
text.21: him these our songs of praise him agni we extol his powers shine out preeminent.
text.22: make our wealth perfect thou o agni lord divine for thou hast kinship with the gods.
text.23: thou rulest as a king oer widelyfamous strength be good to us for thou art great.
text.24: stand up erect to lend us aid stand up like savitar the god.
text.25: erect as strengthbestower we call aloud with unguents and with priests on thee.
text.26: erect preserve us from sore trouble with thy flame burn thou each ravening demon dead.
text.27: raise thou us up that we may walk and live so thou shalt find our worship mid the gods.
text.28: preserve us agni from the fiend preserve us from malicious wrong.
text.29: save us from him who fain would injure us or slay most youthful thou with lofty light.
text.30: smite down as with a club thou who hast fire for teeth smite thou the wicked right and left.
text.31: let not the man who plots against us in the night nor any foe prevail oer us.
text.32: agni hath given heroic might to kaṇva and felicity.
text.33: agni hath helped our friends hath helped medhyātithi hath helped upastuta to win.
text.34: we call on ugradeva yadu turvaśa by means of agni from afar.
text.35: agni bring navavāstva and bṛhadratha turvīti to subdue the foe.
text.36: manu hath stablished thee a light agni for all the race of men.
text.37: sprung from the law oilfed for kaṇva hast thou blazed thou whom the people reverence.
text.38: the flames of agni full of splendour and of might are fearful not to be approached.
text.39: consume for ever all demons and sorcerers consume thou each devouring fiend.
